Questions.QuestionText: If I can’t be bothered cooking, I send out for a ________. (afhaalmaaltijd)
If you’re ________ and you know it clap your hands. (blij)

Exercises.Description: Translate the underlined words into Dutch.
Translate the underlined words into Dutch.

IdiomsCollection.exampleSentence: What is your surname?
What is your name?
Excuse me, sir, could you help me find my brain?
Let me tell you about the birds and the bees, and the flowers and the trees.
I pack my bag in the evening, so I don’t need to in the morning.
If you’re happy and you know it clap your hands.
I met my new best friend in the city centre last Wednesday.
I should get up earlier, because I am always late.
kleine
I love to go swimming, because I’m too sexy for sports that need clothes.
My dad says he wants to go cycling with me, but I don’t want to go outside.
If you put a frog in a pot and slowly turn up the heat, it will enjoy the nice warm bath until it is cooked to death.
You should do your homework as soon as you can, so you don’t finish it too late.
Talk to the hand! I won’t listen.
A chicken slurps grass like spaghetti. Yes, you read that right!
It's fun to learn about foreign cultures.
If I can’t be bothered cooking, I send out for a takeaway.
On Thursday, it is my job to do the dishes.
The teacher has given us an exercise to do for homework.
I really want to see that movie. Did you buy tickets for the cinema tonight?
My father usually prepares dinner, but sometimes my mother and I cook.
I fight with my brother very often - almost every day, in fact.
I hate loud music, but I love soft rock.
The beaches are busy in August because everyone is on holiday then.
It’s nice to do tests. I really enjoy the silence.
I regard him as a man of integrity and high professional competence.
His book is a delightful compendium of important questions.
There is no need to show compassion for him.
The child should be kept away from libidinous movies.
I called the police when my neighbours refused to settle down and end their revelry.
